clusters.title: ‘Icon of American politics’: Democrats heap praise on retiring Nancy Pelosi
clusters.neutral_headline: Nancy Pelosi Announces Retirement After Decades in Congress

items.title: ‘Icon of American politics’: Democrats heap praise on retiring Nancy Pelosi
items.standfirst: Former speaker, 85, hailed as a ‘legendary’ leader who helped usher in new generation of women in politicsDemocrats praised Nancy Pelosi as a “heroic, trailblazing” member of the US House of Representatives, an “icon” and the “greatest speaker in American history”, following her announcement that after 20 terms in Congress she plans to retire.The 85-year-old, the first woman to serve as speaker of the House and one of the most influential leaders in the party, said on Thursday that she would not be seeking re-election in 2026. Continue reading...
items.content: Former speaker, 85, hailed as a ‘legendary’ leader who helped usher in new generation of women in politicsDemocrats praised Nancy Pelosi as a “heroic, trailblazing” member of the US House of Representatives, an “icon” and the “greatest speaker in American history”, following her announcement that after 20 terms in Congress she plans to retire.The 85-year-old, the first woman to serve as speaker of the House and one of the most influential leaders in the party, said on Thursday that she would not be seeking re-election in 2026. Continue reading...

items.title: Nancy Pelosi To Retire At End Of Term
items.standfirst: By George Caldwell, The Daily Signal | November 06, 2025 Speaker Emerita Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., America’s first female speaker of the House and longtime top House Democrat, will retire from Congress at the end of her term, bringing her historic multi-decade career to a close. In a video posted…

In a video posted…

items.title: Nancy Pelosi, former House speaker, to retire from Congress after this term
items.standfirst: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced Thursday she will not seek reelection and will retire from Congress at the end of her term.
items.content: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced Thursday she will not seek reelection and will retire from Congress at the end of her term.

items.title: Nancy Pelosi announces retirement after decades in US Congress
items.standfirst: Pelosi made history as the first female Speaker and left an indelible mark on US politics.
items.content: Pelosi made history as the first female Speaker and left an indelible mark on US politics.

items.title: Nancy Pelosi, first woman US House speaker, to end storied career in Congress
items.standfirst: Nancy Pelosi, a towering figure in Congress over several decades, said Thursday she would not seek reelection in next year's midterm elections, bringing to a close her storied career as not only the first woman to serve as speaker of the House of Representatives but arguably the most powerful in American politics.
items.content: Nancy Pelosi, a towering figure in Congress over several decades, said Thursday she would not seek reelection in next year's midterm elections, bringing to a close her storied career as not only the first woman to serve as speaker of the House of Representatives but arguably the most powerful in American politics.

items.title: Nancy Pelosi, first female US House speaker, to retire from Congress
items.standfirst: Powerful Democrat Pelosi, 85, says she will not seek re-election, but she will finish the final year of her term.
items.content: Powerful Democrat Pelosi, 85, says she will not seek re-election, but she will finish the final year of her term.

items.title: Former Speaker Nancy Pelosi will not seek reelection
items.standfirst: A shrewd political strategist, California Rep. Nancy Pelosi has had an unprecedented career in Congress. First elected in a special election in 1987, Pelosi went on to become one of the most effective leaders of the Democratic party.
items.content: A shrewd political strategist, California Rep. Nancy Pelosi has had an unprecedented career in Congress. First elected in a special election in 1987, Pelosi went on to become one of the most effective leaders of the Democratic party.(Image credit: Leigh Vogel)

ai_summary: Nancy Pelosi, 85, will retire from Congress at the end of her current term in 2026.
She served as the first female Speaker of the House and a prominent party leader.
Pelosi's career spanned two decades, leaving a significant mark on US politics.
Democrats praised her as a "heroic" and "legendary" figure in American politics.
She announced her retirement on Thursday, concluding her storied career in Congress.

items.title: Trump announces plan to cut cost of weight loss drugs and expand access
items.standfirst: Injectable versions of GLP-1s from Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk will see reduced prices and broader coverageDonald Trump announced a plan on Thursday to reduce the costs of some weight loss drugs for certain patients and expand access to them for people on public health insurance.The agreement will make oral version of GLP-1s, which aren’t yet to market but are expected to be approved in the coming months, available at $150 per month for starting doses. Continue reading...

clusters.title: RSF says it agrees to mediators’ ceasefire proposal in Sudan war

items.title: RSF says it agrees to mediators’ ceasefire proposal in Sudan war
items.standfirst: Paramilitary says it will accept a ceasefire proposed by the Quad mediators - the US, Saudi Arabia, Egypt and the UAE.
items.content: Paramilitary says it will accept a ceasefire proposed by the Quad mediators - the US, Saudi Arabia, Egypt and the UAE.

items.title: Sudanese militia group accused of war crimes agrees to a ceasefire
items.standfirst: International mediators broker three-month halt to civil war as further evidence emerges of mass civilian killingsA Sudanese paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of unarmed civilians in an ethnically motivated massacre has agreed to a truce.The Rapid Support Forces (RSF), which is facing mounting criticism over apparent war crimes committed by its fighters in the city of El Fasher last month, said it had agreed to a “humanitarian ceasefire” put forward by the quad countries of the US, Egypt, the UAE and Saudi Arabia. Continue reading...
items.content: International mediators broker three-month halt to civil war as further evidence emerges of mass civilian killingsA Sudanese paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of unarmed civilians in an ethnically motivated massacre has agreed to a truce.The Rapid Support Forces (RSF), which is facing mounting criticism over apparent war crimes committed by its fighters in the city of El Fasher last month, said it had agreed to a “humanitarian ceasefire” put forward by the quad countries of the US, Egypt, the UAE and Saudi Arabia. Continue reading...

items.title: Sudan's RSF militia says it agrees to humanitarian ceasefire
items.standfirst: The group issued the statement after an 18-month siege of the city of el-Fasher in the western Darfur region.
items.content: The group issued the statement after an 18-month siege of the city of el-Fasher in the western Darfur region.

items.title: El-Fasher: 'The final battle of the Darfur Genocide that began in 2003'
items.standfirst: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, at war with the regular army for more than two years, announced on Thursday that they had agreed to a proposal for a humanitarian truce put forward by mediators. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Erin Ogunkeye welcomes Nathaniel Raymond, Executive Director at the YSPH Humanitarian Research Lab and Lecturer at Yale School of Public Health.
items.content: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, at war with the regular army for more than two years, announced on Thursday that they had agreed to a proposal for a humanitarian truce put forward by mediators. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Erin Ogunkeye welcomes Nathaniel Raymond, Executive Director at the YSPH Humanitarian Research Lab and Lecturer at Yale School of Public Health.

items.title: Sudan's RSF paramilitary group agrees to US-backed proposal for humanitarian truce
items.standfirst: Sudan's Rapid Support Force, a paramilitary group that has been at war with the Sudanese military for over two years, said Thursday it had agreed to a humanitarian truce that was proposed by a US-led mediator group known as the Quad. Sudan's army-aligned government indicated earlier this week that it would press on with the war.
items.content: Sudan's Rapid Support Force, a paramilitary group that has been at war with the Sudanese military for over two years, said Thursday it had agreed to a humanitarian truce that was proposed by a US-led mediator group known as the Quad. Sudan's army-aligned government indicated earlier this week that it would press on with the war.

items.title: Sudan's paramilitary forces agree to US-led proposal for humanitarian ceasefire
items.standfirst: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) say they have agreed to a US-led proposal for a humanitarian ceasefire.
items.content: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) say they have agreed to a US-led proposal for a humanitarian ceasefire.

items.title: Sudan paramilitary group agrees to a ceasefire proposal after massacre in an army stronghold it overran
items.standfirst: A paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of Sudanese civilians in a war that has triggered a catastrophic humanitarian crisis said Thursday it had agreed to a ceasefire proposal from U.S.-led mediators, although an American official indicated a final deal had not been struck yet
items.content: A paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of Sudanese civilians in a war that has triggered a catastrophic humanitarian crisis said Thursday it had agreed to a ceasefire proposal from U.S.-led mediators, although an American official indicated a final deal had not been struck yet

ai_summary: The Rapid Support Forces (RSF) agreed to a humanitarian ceasefire proposal.
The proposal was put forward by the US, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and the UAE.
The RSF faces criticism over alleged war crimes in El Fasher.
The ceasefire aims to halt the civil war in Sudan for three months.
The Sudanese army-aligned government previously indicated it would continue the war.

clusters.title: Virginia school teacher shot by six-year-old student awarded $10m in damages
clusters.neutral_headline: Teacher Awarded $10 Million After Being Shot by Student

items.title: Virginia school teacher shot by six-year-old student awarded $10m in damages
items.standfirst: Abigail Zwerner alleged that assistant principal at Newport News elementary school ignored reports that a firearm was on school propertyA Virginia school teacher who was shot by her six-year-old student in 2023 was awarded $10m in damages by a jury on Thursday, concluding a negligence lawsuit she brought against a school administrator.Abigail Zwerner alleged that an assistant principal at the Newport News elementary school where she used to teach ignored multiple reports that a firearm was on school property and likely in the possession of the boy who shot her in January 2023. Continue reading...
items.content: Abigail Zwerner alleged that assistant principal at Newport News elementary school ignored reports that a firearm was on school propertyA Virginia school teacher who was shot by her six-year-old student in 2023 was awarded $10m in damages by a jury on Thursday, concluding a negligence lawsuit she brought against a school administrator.Abigail Zwerner alleged that an assistant principal at the Newport News elementary school where she used to teach ignored multiple reports that a firearm was on school property and likely in the possession of the boy who shot her in January 2023. Continue reading...

items.title: A former teacher shot by her 6-year-old student wins a $10 million jury verdict
items.standfirst: Abby Zwerner's lawsuit accused an administrator of ignoring warnings that a child had a gun at the Newport News, Va., school that day. A bullet damaged her left hand and remains in her chest.
items.content: Abby Zwerner's lawsuit accused an administrator of ignoring warnings that a child had a gun at the Newport News, Va., school that day. A bullet damaged her left hand and remains in her chest.(Image credit: Stephen M. Katz)

clusters.title: Putin orders proposals for possibly resuming nuclear weapons testing in response to Trump
clusters.neutral_headline: Putin Orders Proposals for Resuming Nuclear Weapons Testing

items.title: Putin orders proposals for possibly resuming nuclear weapons testing in response to Trump
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered his government to submit proposals to potentially resume testing nuclear weapons. This comes after President Trump directed the Pentagon to resume nuclear weapons testing "on an equal basis" with other countries. CBS News' Ramy Inocencio has more.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered his government to submit proposals to potentially resume testing nuclear weapons. This comes after President Trump directed the Pentagon to resume nuclear weapons testing "on an equal basis" with other countries. CBS News' Ramy Inocencio has more.

items.title: Russia could start testing nuclear weapons again
items.standfirst: Russia has not conducted a nuclear test since 1990, the year before the collapse of the Soviet Union. But at a Russian Security Council meeting on November 5, President Vladimir Putin said the Kremlin could possibly restart its nuclear testing programmes. The Russian leader's statement is the latest escalation in a tit for tat response to US President Donald Trump's order the week before.
items.content: Russia has not conducted a nuclear test since 1990, the year before the collapse of the Soviet Union. But at a Russian Security Council meeting on November 5, President Vladimir Putin said the Kremlin could possibly restart its nuclear testing programmes. The Russian leader's statement is the latest escalation in a tit for tat response to US President Donald Trump's order the week before.

items.title: Putin orders plans for resuming nuclear tests after Trump comments
items.standfirst: Vladimir Putin ordered his top officials on Wednesday to prepare for resumed nuclear testing, a direct response to President Donald Trump's likewise action.
items.content: Vladimir Putin ordered his top officials on Wednesday to prepare for resumed nuclear testing, a direct response to President Donald Trump's likewise action.

ai_summary: Vladimir Putin ordered proposals for potentially resuming nuclear weapons testing.
This action is in response to President Trump's directive.
Russia has not conducted nuclear tests since 1990.
Putin's statement is an escalation in response to Trump's order.
The Russian Security Council discussed the possible restart of testing.

clusters.title: World’s oldest president sworn in for eighth term in Cameroon
clusters.neutral_headline: World’s Oldest President Sworn In for Eighth Term

items.title: World’s oldest president sworn in for eighth term in Cameroon
items.standfirst: Paul Biya has been in power since 1982 - the opposition says the election was rigged.
items.content: Paul Biya has been in power since 1982 - the opposition says the election was rigged.

items.title: Cameroon: World’s oldest president sworn in for eighth term
items.standfirst: Cameroon’s Paul Biya has been sworn in for his eighth consecutive term after winning last month’s presidential election. Issa Tchiroma Bakary, the other presidential candidate, maintains that he was the rightful winner of the poll and has accused the authorities of fraud - allegations they have denied.
items.content: Cameroon’s Paul Biya has been sworn in for his eighth consecutive term after winning last month’s presidential election. Issa Tchiroma Bakary, the other presidential candidate, maintains that he was the rightful winner of the poll and has accused the authorities of fraud - allegations they have denied.

items.title: Cameroon’s Biya, world’s oldest ruler at 92, sworn in for eighth term
items.standfirst: Deadly protests followed the 92-year-old president's re-election, which opponents have called 'fraudulent'.
items.content: Deadly protests followed the 92-year-old president's re-election, which opponents have called 'fraudulent'.

ai_summary: Paul Biya was sworn in for his eighth consecutive term in Cameroon.
He has been in power since 1982, making him the world's oldest ruler.
Opposition parties claim the election was fraudulent.
Deadly protests followed Biya's re-election.
Issa Tchiroma Bakary maintains he was the rightful winner.

items.title: Philippines declares state of emergency after typhoon Kalmaegi death toll passes 100
items.standfirst: The deaths were mostly from drowning in flash floods, with 127 people still missing, many in the hard-hit central province of CebuPhilippine president Ferdinand Marcos Jr has declared a state of emergency after typhoon Kalmaegi left at least 114 people dead and nearly 130 missing in central provinces in the deadliest natural disaster to hit the country this year.The deaths were mostly from drowning in flash floods, and 127 people were still missing, many in the hard-hit central province of Cebu. The tropical cyclone blew out of the archipelago on Wednesday into the South China Sea. Continue reading...
items.content: The deaths were mostly from drowning in flash floods, with 127 people still missing, many in the hard-hit central province of CebuPhilippine president Ferdinand Marcos Jr has declared a state of emergency after typhoon Kalmaegi left at least 114 people dead and nearly 130 missing in central provinces in the deadliest natural disaster to hit the country this year.The deaths were mostly from drowning in flash floods, and 127 people were still missing, many in the hard-hit central province of Cebu. The tropical cyclone blew out of the archipelago on Wednesday into the South China Sea. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Trump says if supreme court rules against sweeping tariffs it could leave US on hook to pay back ‘trillions of dollars’ – live
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Says Tariffs Could Cost US Trillions

items.title: Trump says if supreme court rules against sweeping tariffs it could leave US on hook to pay back ‘trillions of dollars’ – live
items.standfirst: President notes such a ruling would be ‘somewhat catastrophic’ for the USIt’s now day 37 of the ongoing government shutdown, the longest on record, with both parties continuing to blame the other for the lapse in funding.For his part, Donald Trump has turned his attention to the filibuster – the procedural mechanism that requires 60 votes in the Senate to end debate on a piece of legislation and bring it to the floor for a vote. He’s hammered home his wishes on Truth Social, and in front of lawmakers at a White House breakfast on Tuesday. Continue reading...
items.content: President notes such a ruling would be ‘somewhat catastrophic’ for the USIt’s now day 37 of the ongoing government shutdown, the longest on record, with both parties continuing to blame the other for the lapse in funding.For his part, Donald Trump has turned his attention to the filibuster – the procedural mechanism that requires 60 votes in the Senate to end debate on a piece of legislation and bring it to the floor for a vote. He’s hammered home his wishes on Truth Social, and in front of lawmakers at a White House breakfast on Tuesday. Continue reading...

items.title: When is a tariff not a tax? When I say so, Trump tells supreme court
items.standfirst: The fate of the US president’s signature, globe-rattling economic policy is in the hands of a court he shapedDonald Trump faced arguably the biggest test so far of his contentious use of executive power at the US supreme court on Wednesday. The stakes could not be higher – “literally, LIFE OR DEATH” for the US, at least according to the president.Trump’s signature, globe-rattling economic policy, his sweeping tariffs regime, was in the dock – specifically, the legal mechanism his administration has used to enforce it. And the man dispatched to defend the White House put forward a somewhat puzzling argument. Continue reading...
items.content: The fate of the US president’s signature, globe-rattling economic policy is in the hands of a court he shapedDonald Trump faced arguably the biggest test so far of his contentious use of executive power at the US supreme court on Wednesday. The stakes could not be higher – “literally, LIFE OR DEATH” for the US, at least according to the president.Trump’s signature, globe-rattling economic policy, his sweeping tariffs regime, was in the dock – specifically, the legal mechanism his administration has used to enforce it. And the man dispatched to defend the White House put forward a somewhat puzzling argument. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Louvre security failures exposed in report by France's auditing body

items.title: Louvre security failures exposed in report by France's auditing body
items.standfirst: France's court of auditors urged the Louvre museum to speed up its security modernisation plans as a priority, in a report conducted before the jewel heist that noted major delays in the renovation of the world’s most-visited museum. It said the museum's investments prioritised “visible and attractive operations” like buying new pieces of art and improving visitor experience at the expense of the maintenance and renovation of buildings and technical installations.
items.content: France's court of auditors urged the Louvre museum to speed up its security modernisation plans as a priority, in a report conducted before the jewel heist that noted major delays in the renovation of the world’s most-visited museum. It said the museum's investments prioritised “visible and attractive operations” like buying new pieces of art and improving visitor experience at the expense of the maintenance and renovation of buildings and technical installations.

items.title: Louvre heist a ‘deafening wake-up call’, says auditor
items.standfirst: Report says Paris museum prioritised ‘visible and attractive’ projects over security in run-up to robberyEurope live – latest updatesThe spectacular theft of an estimated €88m (£77m) of crown jewels from the Louvre last month was “a deafening wake-up call” for the “wholly inadequate pace” of security upgrades at the Paris museum, the head of France’s state auditor has said.Presenting the report, which was completed before the dramatic heist at the world’s most-visited museum, Pierre Moscovici said the Louvre had sufficient funds for the improvements and “must now implement them without fail”. Continue reading...
items.content: Report says Paris museum prioritised ‘visible and attractive’ projects over security in run-up to robberyEurope live – latest updatesThe spectacular theft of an estimated €88m (£77m) of crown jewels from the Louvre last month was “a deafening wake-up call” for the “wholly inadequate pace” of security upgrades at the Paris museum, the head of France’s state auditor has said.Presenting the report, which was completed before the dramatic heist at the world’s most-visited museum, Pierre Moscovici said the Louvre had sufficient funds for the improvements and “must now implement them without fail”. Continue reading...
